TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CodeIdentifiers extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Maintains a group of names for related code entities or type mappings that are generated by the .NET Framework's XML serialization infrastructure.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following list identifies tools and classes that use the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers>:
- The [Web Services Description Language Tool (Wsdl.exe)](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/b9210348-8bc2-4367-8c91-d1a04b403e88), or the <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionImporter> class, while generating client proxy classes or abstract server classes from a Web Services Description Language (WSDL) document.
- The [XML Schema Definition Tool (Xsd.exe)](~/docs/framework/serialization/xml-schema-definition-tool-xsd-exe.md) tool while generating classes from XML Schema Definition (XSD) documents.
- The <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescriptionReflector> class while creating <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> objects from classes that are identified as Web services via the <xref:System.Web.Services.WebServiceAttribute> attribute.
Instead of using the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class directly, use the aforementioned tools or classes. If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes.
Depending on its scope, a <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> instance can be used to maintain the names of any of the items in the following list:
- Types, methods, or fields.
- The parameters and return value of a method corresponding to WSDL input and output messages.
- Objects within a <xref:System.Web.Services.Description.ServiceDescription> instance that can be serialized to a WSDL document.
Typically, the class is used to avoid naming collisions between code entities within a particular scope, including collisions with the name of a containing entity.

MemberSignature.Value: public CodeIdentifiers ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public CodeIdentifiers (bool caseSensitive);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(bool caseSensitive) cil managed

Docs.param: if identifiers are case sensitive; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class and determines whether code identifiers are case sensitive.

MemberSignature.Value: public void Add (string identifier, object value);
.method public hidebysig instance void Add(string identifier, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: A name that is used to index the code entity.
The code entity or type mapping information.
Docs.summary: Adds a named code entity or type mapping to the instance's scope.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Unlike the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddUnique%2A> method, the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.Add%2A> method does not prevent naming collisions.
If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class. For a complete list, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void AddReserved (string identifier);
.method public hidebysig instance void AddReserved(string identifier) cil managed

Docs.param: A name that will not be available within the instance's scope.
Docs.summary: Prevents a specified name from being used within the instance's scope.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A reserved name can belong to a containing code entity, such as a type for which member names must also be generated.

MemberSignature.Value: public string AddUnique (string identifier, object value);
.method public hidebysig instance string AddUnique(string identifier, object value) cil managed

Docs.param: A candidate name that is used to index the code entity.
The code entity or type mapping information.
Docs.summary: Adds a named code entity or type mapping to the instance's scope, ensuring that the name is unique within the scope.
Docs.returns: The identifier parameter value or a modified string if there is a name collision.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the identifier parameter value is not unique within the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> instance's scope, a new, unique string is generated and used in its place. The new string is generated by appending to the input name. The original name is not unique if it was passed previously to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddUnique%2A>, or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddReserved%2A> method, or if it was generated by a previous call to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddUnique%2A> method. In each case, if the new identifier is not unique, it is first passed to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.MakeUnique%2A> method to create a new unique identifier.
If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class. For a complete list, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void Clear ();
.method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all code entities or type mappings, including their names, from the instance's scope.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Reserved names, as added through the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddReserved%2A> method, are not removed.
If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class. For a complete list, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public bool IsInUse (string identifier);
.method public hidebysig instance bool IsInUse(string identifier) cil managed

Docs.param: The name to check for use within the instance's scope.
Docs.summary: Determines whether a specified name is already being used within the instance's scope.
Docs.returns: if the name is already in use; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The input name is not unique if it was passed previously to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddUnique%2A>, or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddReserved%2A> method, or if it was generated by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddUnique%2A> method.
If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class. For a complete list, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public string MakeRightCase (string identifier);
.method public hidebysig instance string MakeRightCase(string identifier) cil managed

Docs.summary: Ensures that the input is of the correct case by modifying the name according to the value of the property.
Docs.returns: A string that is the same as the input identifier or has the first letter's case modified.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the value of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.UseCamelCasing%2A> property is `true` and the first character of the input is a letter, it is made lowercase, if necessary. If the value of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.UseCamelCasing%2A> is `false`, Pascal case is in effect and the first character, if a letter, is capitalized, if necessary.

MemberSignature.Value: public string MakeUnique (string identifier);
.method public hidebysig instance string MakeUnique(string identifier) cil managed

Docs.param: The name to modify if it is not already unique.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the input name conflicts with another name within the instance's scope and, if it does, generates a modified string.
Docs.returns: The identifier parameter value or a modified string if there is a name collision.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The input name is not unique if it was passed previously to the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddUnique%2A>, or <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddReserved%2A> method, or if it was generated by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers.AddUnique%2A> method. If the name is not unique, a new string is generated by appending to the original string.
If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class. For a complete list, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void Remove (string identifier);
.method public hidebysig instance void Remove(string identifier) cil managed

Docs.param: The name of the code entity or type mapping information to remove.
Docs.summary: Removes from the instance's scope the code entity or type mapping identified by the input name.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class. For a complete list, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public void RemoveReserved (string identifier);
.method public hidebysig instance void RemoveReserved(string identifier) cil managed

Docs.param: A name that will be made available within the instance's scope.
Docs.summary: Removes the input name from the instance's reserved names.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class.

MemberSignature.Value: public object ToArray (Type type);
.method public hidebysig instance object ToArray(class System.Type type) cil managed

Docs.param: The type of all the code entities or type mappings for the instance.
Docs.summary: Returns an array of the code entities or type mappings within the instance's scope.
Docs.returns: An array of the code entities or type mappings that is stored by the object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If you want to control the names of code entities that are bound to XML Schema or Web service definitions, use the associated attributes rather than creating an instance of the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.CodeIdentifiers> class. For a complete list, see [Attributes That Control XML Serialization](~/docs/framework/serialization/attributes-that-control-xml-serialization.md).

MemberSignature.Value: public bool UseCamelCasing { get; set; }
.property instance bool UseCamelCasing

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the instance uses camel case.
Docs.value: to indicate that the instance uses camel case; to indicate that the instance uses Pascal case.

remarks.format: ## Remarks With camel case, if the first character of an identifier is a letter, it must be lowercase. With Pascal case, if the first character is a letter, it must be uppercase.
